thread.title: Mississippi ex-parole officer pleads guilty to taking bribes
thread.title_full: Mississippi ex-parole officer pleads guilty to taking bribes - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Mississippi ex-parole officer pleads guilty to taking bribes
text:
By JEFF AMY
Associated Press JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - A former Mississippi parole officer is pleading guilty to a federal charge that he took bribes from a parolee he was supervising.
Andra (AHN'-dray) Smith entered the plea Friday before a federal judge, admitting he took $2,400 from a man he was supervising to allow the parolee to leave Mississippi for work.
Smith faces up to 10 years in prison and up to $250,000 in fines. Federal prosecutors say they also want him to repay the bribe money.
Prosecutors say there are audio and video recordings of Smith taking the bribe from the parolee, and that he was bribed with money from the FBI, indicating authorities were already suspicious.
U.S. District Judge Tom Lee scheduled Smith's sentencing for Jan. 7. He remains free on $10,000 unsecured bail.
